intro: Artemisia tridentata var. arbuscula, commonly known as wormwood or sagebrush, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and small, yellowish-green flower heads. The plant contains volatile oils, including thujone, which contribute to its strong, medicinal scent. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities and a resource for traditional and modern herbal uses.
